title: Esham -1990- Homey Don't Play!

and Underground Rap

128kbps

2. Some Old Wicket Shit!!! (Remix) 
3. Out'cha Mind"    
4. Crewzin Down 7 Mile    

 

 
Bio:
 

Esham Attica Smith is an American rapper from Detroit, Michigan known for his hallucinogenic style of hip hop which he refers to as "acid rap", which fuses rock-based beats and lyrics involving subjects such as death, drug use, evil, paranoia and sex.

Also known as: Esham The Unholy, Esham The Boogieman, Homey The Clown, Bruce Wayne, East Side Hoes And Money, & Mr. Spade

Esham and his brother James Smith ran the biggest selling independent hip hop label in Detroit, Michigan throughout the 1990's. Their influence spawned an entire sub-genre within hip hop that eventually fueled the careers of Eminem, Tech N9ne, ICP and Kid Rock.

Homey Don't Play is the first extended play by Esham. Released in 1990, the EP marks the debut of "Homey the Clown", a persona Smith would later revive for his 2009 EP I Ain't Cha Homey. According to Insane Clown Posse member Joseph Bruce, the EP's cover, which depicted Esham wearing clown paint, inspired the group's use of face paint in their act.
